Proud to support the passage of the Debbie Smith Act of 2019, which will provide much-needed resources to state and local law enforcement agencies to help speed up the testing of rape kits and ensure that the perpetrators of sexual assault are brought to justice faster.

This week the Senate passed legislation to support America’s law enforcement community :
 
✔️ Declared May 12-18 as Police Week
✔️ Reauthorized funding for bulletproof vests
✔️ Increased death and disability benefits
✔️ Funded stress and mental health programs pic.twitter.com/gb74u2deyb

Today, I published a joint op-ed with @GOPLeader in @washingtonpost about anti-Semitism and the toxic BDS movement: https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/mitch-mcconnell-and-kevin-mccarthy-the-house-must-stand-against-the-toxic-bds-movement/2019/05/14/413e24ee-75bc-11e9-bd25-c989555e7766_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.23aef598d939 …

A core feature of this anti-Semitic trend is the BDS movement, a political and economic attack on Israel’s right to exist. In February, the Senate passed bipartisan legislation that included a counter-BDS provision. Now the House must do the same.

There is a rising tide of anti-Semitism in the world, a scourge that is spreading in the Middle East, in Europe and even here in the United States. Political leaders on both sides of the aisle have a responsibility to confront this ugliness head-on.
